datasets.name: 0ae67941
queryLines:
SELECT
  ag.*,
  c.*,
  w.warehouse_id AS warehouse_id,
  w.warehouse_name AS warehouse_name,
  w.warehouse_type AS warehouse_type,
  w.warehouse_size AS warehouse_size,
  w.tags AS warehouse_tags
FROM billing.azure.actuals_gold ag
LEFT JOIN system.compute.clusters c
  ON CAST(ag.parsedTags:ClusterId AS STRING) = c.cluster_id
LEFT JOIN system.compute.warehouses w
  ON CAST(ag.parsedTags:SqlEndpointId AS STRING) = w.warehouse_id

datasets.name: 538a5330
queryLines:
WITH
usage as (
  select
    date_trunc('QUARTER', date) as usage_quarter,
    date_trunc('MONTH', date) as usage_month,
    date_trunc('WEEK', date) as usage_week,
    u.*
  from actuals_gold as u
),
-- eval time_key param
usage_time_key as (
  select
    identifier
    (
      case
        when :param_time_key = 'Quarter' then 'usage_quarter'
        when :param_time_key = 'Month' then 'usage_month'
        when :param_time_key = 'Week' then 'usage_week'
        else 'date'
      end
    ) as time_key,
    *
  from usage
),
tag_entry_parsing AS (
  SELECT
    EXPLODE(
      SPLIT(
        IF(
          TRIM(:param_single_tag_key) = '<USE TAG FILTER>',
          :param_tag_entries,
          :param_single_tag_key
        ),
        ';'
      )
    ) AS tag_entry,
    CONTAINS(tag_entry, '=') AS is_filter,
    IF(is_filter, SPLIT(tag_entry, '=')[0], tag_entry) AS tag_key
),
tag_entry_parsed AS (
  SELECT
    ARRAY_SORT(COLLECT_LIST(tag_key)) AS all_keys,
    ARRAY_SORT(COLLECT_LIST(IF(is_filter, tag_key, NULL))) AS filter_keys,
    ARRAY_SORT(COLLECT_LIST(IF(is_filter, tag_entry, NULL))) AS filter_expected
  FROM tag_entry_parsing
),
usage_with_matching_tag_kvp AS (
  SELECT * FROM (
    SELECT
      TRANSFORM(
        filter_keys,
        k -> CONCAT(k, '=', FROM_JSON(CAST(parsedTags AS STRING), 'MAP<STRING, STRING>')[k])
      ) AS filter_actual,
      TRANSFORM(
        all_keys,
        k -> CONCAT(k, '=', FROM_JSON(CAST(parsedTags AS STRING), 'MAP<STRING, STRING>')[k])
      ) AS kvp,
      IF(
        SIZE(filter_keys) = 0 OR filter_actual = filter_expected,
        ARRAY_JOIN(kvp, ';'),
        ''
      ) AS _custom_tag_key_value_pairs,
      IF(_custom_tag_key_value_pairs = "", "<MISMATCH>", _custom_tag_key_value_pairs) AS custom_tag_key_value_pairs,
      *
    FROM usage_time_key, tag_entry_parsed
  ) WHERE :param_show_tag_mismatch = 'Yes' OR custom_tag_key_value_pairs != '<MISMATCH>'
)

SELECT
  time_key, meterName, meterSubCategory, meterCategory, vendor, custom_tag_key_value_pairs, price
FROM usage_with_matching_tag_kvp

datasets.name: 4c5663a7

lines: **Databricks Cloud Infrastructure Cost (Azure)** - This dashboard includes the cloud infrastructure & DBU costs related to Azure Databricks - The cost includes cost related to VM, storage, networking - Use the global filter for Vendor = Databricks, to filter for just costs related to Databricks deployment (by default, all Azure services are included from Cost Management export) \\

filters.expression: `meterCategory` IS NULL OR `meterCategory` NOT IN ('Azure Databricks')

lines: **Cost by compute** - View detailed costs by compute type - cluster or warehouse - Please note that several cost types will not be tied to a cluster or warehouse, such as severless notebooks, endpoints, networking, apps etc.
Show usage without the matching tags as `<MISMATCH>`

frame.title: Cost per tag key, value pair

lines: **Cost by tags** - Group and filter costs by tags - these include tags applied directly in Azure, but also Databricks
